meanings.definition: A network of polymer chains that are hydrophilic, sometimes found as a colloidal gel in which water is the dispersion medium.
meanings.sent1: The hydrogels in the experiment absorbed water quickly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how hydrogels can be used in medical applications.
meanings.sent3: The hydrogels at the party soaked up all the spilled drinks.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like hydrogels expanding in water.
meanings.sent5: The hydrogels resembled a sponge, soaking up every drop of liquid.

meanings.definition: A substance formed when a polymer network is swollen with water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrogels used in the project expanded when water was added.
meanings.sent2: The hydrogels provided a stable environment for the cells to grow.
meanings.sent3: The hydrogels in the garden seemed to plump up after a heavy rain.
meanings.sent4: His heart swelled with emotion, like hydrogels absorbing water.
meanings.sent5: The hydrogels transformed into a soft, jelly-like material when hydrated.
